qas.question: What was the total average family size?
What percent of households were made of one person?
What percent of households had someone over 65 living in it?
Roughly how many same-sex couples were there?
What percent of household have children under 18?
How many people under 18 are there in Santa Monica?
How many people under 65 are there in Santa Monica?
How many same-sex female married couples are there?
What is the average household size for those 65 and older?
What is the average family size for same-sex married couples?

context: There were <b6_0>46,917<b6_0/> households, out of which <b5_0>7,835<b5_0/> (<a4_0>16.7%<a4_0/>) had children under the age of 18 living in them, 13,092 (27.9%) were opposite-sex married couples living together, 3,510 (7.5%) had a female householder with no husband present, 1,327 (2.8%) had a male householder with no wife present. There were 2,867 (6.1%) unmarried opposite-sex partnerships, and <a3_0><b7_0>416<b7_0/><a3_0/> (0.9%) same-sex married couples or partnerships. 22,716 households (<a1_0>48.4%<a1_0/>) were made up of individuals and 5,551 (<a2_0>11.8%<a2_0/>) had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was <b8_0>1.87<b8_0/>. There were 17,929 families (38.2% of all households); the average family size was <a0_0><b9_0>2.79<b9_0/><a0_0/>.
